title: S-Curves: Why New Technologies Start Slow and Finish Fast
description: A fast breakdown of S-Curves: Why New Technologies Start Slow and Finish Fast for builders.

hook.text: The internet had 10 million users in 1995 and 5 billion by 2023.

buildup.text: Technology adoption follows an S-curve: slow start as early adopters tinker.

discovery.text: Cars, electricity, telephones, smartphones ‚Äî every transformative technology followed the same S-curve.

twist.text: Companies die when they confuse the slow start for failure.

climax.text: S-curves explain why predictions about technology are always wrong.

punchline.text: Every revolution looks like a toy in the beginning and obvious in hindsight.

quiz.question: Why do people consistently underestimate new technologies?
